Articles.Content:
Okay. Thanks so much!

Guess the kerbal had to ditch after doing one too many stupid maneuvers ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

This is gonna be my new laptop wallpaper ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Hey Columbia, your Konkorde render is complete! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![k7UjYiz.png](http://i.imgur.com/k7UjYiz.png)
Very nice! I would like to see one great masterpiece made entirely in Blender, though, not just superimposed renders.

> 
> Very nice! I would like to see one great masterpiece made entirely in Blender, though, not just superimposed renders.

It's a good long-term project. I'd have to get it just right. ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

I've been playing with the cloud tools, I might put clouds in next.
Grats on your Facebook feature!

Hi Starwhip! May I import the craft into blender myself and give you the blender file with textures? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-11T20:05:34Z" title="07/11/2015 08:05  PM" data-short="9 yr">July 11, 2015</time> by Enceos**

> 
> Hi Starwhip! May I import the craft into blender myself and give you the blender file with textures? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

An interesting request, sure, why not? ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Working on clouds for a future render, liking what I'm seeing so far. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![b1NYqnS.png](http://i.imgur.com/b1NYqnS.png)

> 
> Working on clouds for a future render, liking what I'm seeing so far. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
> [http://i.imgur.com/b1NYqnS.png](http://i.imgur.com/b1NYqnS.png)

It's funny, because I am looking at Andrew Price's tutorial as well ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

(If he made a readable version of his tutorials, this would go a lot faster..)

> 
> It's funny, because I am looking at Andrew Price's tutorial as well ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
> (If he made a readable version of his tutorials, this would go a lot faster..)

Love Andrew Price, his Blender tutorials are very informative. I usually watch them on higher speeds (1.5 is mostly)

**@StarWhip** Could you please try opening this .blend file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/br0wzpisgp4si9k/OMS%20Apple.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/br0wzpisgp4si9k/OMS%20Apple.rar?dl=0)

I packed all external data before saving.

The craft inside is similar to this:

[TABLE=width: 500]

[TR]

[TD]![yK9aEgR.png](http://i.imgur.com/yK9aEgR.png)[/TD]

[TD]![FEddcpH.png](http://i.imgur.com/FEddcpH.png)[/TD]

[/TR]

[/TABLE]

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-12T19:10:00Z" title="07/12/2015 07:10  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 12, 2015</time> by Enceos**

Enceos' OMS Apple perches on the edge of a Duna canyon as it's pilot watches the sunrise.

![dZvzmrZ.png](http://i.imgur.com/dZvzmrZ.png)

EDIT: Everything but the sun's lens flare was done within Cycles.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-14T12:40:11Z" title="07/14/2015 12:40  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 14, 2015</time> by Starwhip**

> 
> **@StarWhip** Could you please try opening this .blend file: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/br0wzpisgp4si9k/OMS%20Apple.rar?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/br0wzpisgp4si9k/OMS%20Apple.rar?dl=0)
> I packed all external data before saving.
> 
> The craft inside is similar to this:
> 
> [TABLE=width: 500]
> 
> [TR]
> 
> [TD][http://i.imgur.com/yK9aEgR.png](http://i.imgur.com/yK9aEgR.png)[/TD]
> 
> [TD][http://i.imgur.com/FEddcpH.png](http://i.imgur.com/FEddcpH.png)[/TD]
> 
> [/TR]
> 
> [/TABLE]

What are those parts?

Did I miss an update of something?
They are modded parts I think, definitely not stock.

> 
> They are modded parts I think, definitely not stock.

Modded parts, yep. I don't know what mod they're from, you could PM Enceos though.

> 
> What are those parts?
> Did I miss an update of something?

They craft is made from USI Exploration, KIS and AIES parts, also a small TAC Life Support hexcan is visible under the solar panels.

> 
> Modded parts, yep. I don't know what mod they're from, you could PM Enceos though.

Wait, you can render modded parts?

> 
> Wait, you can render modded parts?

The addon *technically* supports mod parts, yes. They may or may not import correctly. However, it would require me to install all the mods required to make the craft, possibly all of the mods in the users's GameData directory.

Enceos sent me the .blend file with the craft already imported.

In the OP of the thread I put up a download for a Blender install with the .craft importer for others to use. If you want a modded craft rendered, you'll need to import it yourself and send me the .blend. The download includes a set of instructions (README.txt) for setting up the importer plugins and importing your craft.

Alright, could you do *Base Package 1* entering Laythe's atmosphere (With view of the surface) and Jool hanging in the background?

I know it sounds like much, but it would be epic to see.

Here it is: [http://kerbalx.com/DMSP/Base%20Package%201](http://kerbalx.com/DMSP/Base%20Package%201)

Also, it hit 150 downloads!

> 
> Alright, could you do *Base Package 1* entering Laythe's atmosphere (With view of the surface) and Jool hanging in the background?
> I know it sounds like much, but it would be epic to see.
> 
> Here it is: [http://kerbalx.com/DMSP/Base%20Package%201](http://kerbalx.com/DMSP/Base%20Package%201)
> 
> Also, it hit 150 downloads!

I will attempt it, though I once again will say that I would prefer stock craft.

> 
> I will attempt it, though I once again will say that I would prefer stock craft.

Alright, this will be a one off.

Is blender free? or does it cost money?

Also, anything about doing the rest of my american planes pack?

> 
> Is blender free? or does it cost money?
> Also, anything about doing the rest of my american planes pack?

It costs exactly $0,000,000.00. You can get it here. [Blender.org](http://www.blender.org/)

I'm still trying to figure out atmospheres for DMSP's Jool render. I don't want to hold up the line though, so I might do those planes in the meantime.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-23T17:09:34Z" title="07/23/2015 05:09  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 23, 2015</time> by Starwhip**
  
Darn manual BBCode. :P

Hey could you do my F/A-18?

Download [**here**](http://kerbalx.com/YargJay9991/Koeing-FA-18-Hornet). If you could send me one without GIMP effects and one with, that would be great! I wouldn't seeing it looks like without effects. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Also, I would love to be able to do this for myself but can't figure out how to import them at all! Maybe you could send me a .obj of it? That way I can try the rendering bit for myself!

Love your work btw!

Thanks

YargJay9991

PS Checkout my other aircraft [here.](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/120295-J-Space-Ind-HIRING-WITH-LIMITED-PLACES)

This... was an unusual idea. I absolutely love the result... let me know if you want it changed. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

![PuDILgh.png](http://i.imgur.com/PuDILgh.png)

EDIT:

Yeah, the resolution is kind of crazy. 1722 x 723. I'm sure there must be a monitor out there with that ratio right? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-24T15:37:32Z" title="07/24/2015 03:37  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 24, 2015</time> by Starwhip**
